intro: Pentas schimperi subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western pentas, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, star-shaped flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its compact growth habit and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to both gardens and landscapes.
